2. Verbs of liking and disliking. Are the following sentences true or false?

  1. Most politicians like their clothes to look unusual.
    truefalse

  2. Teenagers today prefer their clothes to look different than their parent's.
    true false

  3. Many middle-aged people today want their clothes to be comfortable.
    true false

  4. Some people hate their jeans to be baggy while other people love them.
    true false

  5. Some people prefer their work clothes to be quite formal.
    true false

  6. Most jeans manufacturers want their customers to be happy with their jeans.
    true false

  7. Youngsters hate their sweatshirts to have trendy logos.
    true false

  8. Toddlers love their clothes to be stylish.
    true false

  9. Many people like their jeans to look faded.
    true false

  10. Elderly people love their jeans to be very tight.
    true false

3. Look at these sentences from exercise 2.

- Most politicians like their clothes to look unusual.
- Most teenagers today prefer their clothes to look different than their parent's.
- Many middle-aged people want their clothes to be comfortable.
- Youngsters hate their sweatshirts to have trendy logos.
- Toddlers love their clothes to be stylish.

The verbs like, love, prefer, want, hate can all follow the pattern:

subject + verb + object + infinitive + adjective/noun
